title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 August 2016 - XWiki

17:29 <boubou> anyone can give me the link for the issue with xwiki and tomcat 7.0.54 ?  
17:29 <boubou> Im pretty sure there was a bug report but I cant remember  
17:29 <boubou> where  
17:31 <cjd> mmm I don't recall specifically if it's .54 but there is a version after which they broke their space handling so spaces in URLs are broken  
17:31 <cjd> XWiki can't really adapt to tomcat without #1 breaking space handling in all other containers and #2 breaking space handling in older versions of tomcat  
17:39 <tmortagne> cjd: what you are talking about is http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13556  
17:40 <cjd> right, so boubou I'm not thinking of what you are...  
17:40 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
17:40 <tmortagne> what boubou is talking about is something wrong with 7.0.53 I think but don't remember exactly what it was  
17:41 <boubou> tmortagne 7.0.54 ;)  
17:43 <tmortagne> boubou: you sure there was a jira ? mabe it was just a discussion on IRC or mailing list  
17:44 <boubou> cant remember :(  
17:44 <boubou> maybe it was a bug report with Tomcat  
17:46 <tmortagne> I do remember there was something about 7.0.5\*  
17:47 <tmortagne> what I do remember is that it was a regression introduce in a version and fixed in the next  
17:50 <tmortagne> boubou: forget that the thing I had in mind was a regression in 8.0.32 and fixed on 8.0.33, no idea what you are talking about after all  
17:50 <tmortagne> (was XWIKI-13317)  
17:50 <boubou> ok  
18:02 <lincolna> has quit  
18:03 <boubou> does the file should still exist ? /var/lib/tomcat/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/classes/logging.properties  
18:05 <tmortagne> boubou: this file is not used anymore no  
18:27 <mflorea> has quit  
19:33 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:37 <Slashman> has quit  
19:46 <ansuz> has quit  
19:46 <barretto> has joined #xwiki  
19:51 <barretto> hi guys, I'm choosing a wiki platform for an collaborative plataform and I would like to ask if it is possible to create template pages, with pre-determined sections which will be described by users. So, users may fill section contents but cannot change sections headers or ordering. Is it possible?  
19:59 <woshilapin> has quit  
20:03 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
20:18 <cjd> barretto: it sounds like you're looking for Structured Data, it has these benefits as well as others, for example you can query by the value of a field  
20:18 <cjd> you might want to take a look at XWiki App Within Minutes, it's for creating "classes" of structured data  
20:19 <cjd> If you just want a guideline template, we have those too, but they do not enforce that you must not change certain parts  
20:48 <woshilapin> has quit  
20:49 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
20:54 <barretto> sound interesting  
20:55 <barretto> i have to create some pages, all with same structure (static structure) but its content will be provided by our users  
20:56 <barretto> like a wiki, with a fixed structure  
20:56 <cjd> Yes, this is most of what we do with XWiki for our intranet  
20:56 <barretto> all features of a wiki are supposed to be working just as it would in a  
20:57 <barretto> in a "open structure" page  
20:57 <cjd> With App Within Minutes, you get to make a "sheet" (displayer) of the user's data so you can decide how it will look, you also can control the edit sheet  
20:58 <cjd> by default this is just a sequence of their data, if you want to go complex then you can edit the wiki code of the sheet  
20:58 <cjd> now if you're thinking more simple, then you just want a template page, something to get somebody started but not to restrain them in any way  
20:59 <barretto> they cannot change the page structure  
20:59 <barretto> another important aspect to me is that those pre-structured pages could be created by API, since these strucutres are in a DB. I would develop a java backend that would read this data and create the pages  
20:59 <cjd> ok so you have like hundreds or thousands of these structures ?  
21:00 <barretto> basically there are ~10k pages with the same structure, but with different titles and content  
21:01 <cjd> ok  
21:01 <cjd> oh sorry, I thought you were asking to create the \*structures\* through the API  
21:01 <cjd> creating pages with structured data programmatically is quite simple  
21:02 <cjd> you can also use the REST API  
21:02 <barretto> sound cool  
21:02 <barretto> its xml based, right?  
21:02 <barretto> is there a JSON api?  
21:02 <cjd> REST is XML or JSON as you wish  
21:03 <cjd> it talks both  
22:00 <barretto> cjd it sounds really interesting... I'm going to give it a try locally and run some tests  
22:00 <cjd> ok, if you have any other questions don't hesitate to ask  
22:01 <barretto> is there any documentation about creating pages programatically? and how to set this structures permanent?  
22:01 <barretto> (or I will find it straightfoward at API documentation?)  
22:02 <cjd> I think the API reference is going to be the most straight forward  
22:02 <cjd> getDocument()  addObject()  getObject()   set('property\_name', $value  
22:02 <cjd> etc  
22:23 <barretto> got an out of bounds exception while installing... do you mind  to take a look?  
22:23 <barretto> seems DB connection was stablished  
22:23 <barretto> tables were created  
22:24 <barretto> http://pastebin.com/U5W54TfZ  
22:41 <cjd> for testing why not just use the .zip version ?  
22:41 <cjd> ./start\_xwiki.sh and it's up  
22:41 <cjd> self-contained  
22:43 <barretto> it is important to understand full installation process because I'll have to describe it to the infrastucture manager  
22:43 <barretto> we'll test it in a test-server environment  
22:44 <barretto> probably later, I will have to move further and try to install and run it from github repo  
22:56 <barretto> i'm using .war  tomcat7/ubuntu  
23:00 <cjd> make sure you're using the correct version of the mysql connector for your version of mysql  
23:05 <barretto> you nailed it, my bad  
23:06 <cjd> it was a wild guess :)  
23:11 <barretto> well, i have to leave now... I'll get back tomorrow with some (positive) feedback  
23:12 <barretto> thanks a lot  
23:12 <barretto> (y)  
23:14 <woshilapin> has quit  
23:16 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki
